article:
The 'Improved Order of Heptasophs' is a fraternal organization established in
1878 when its founding members split from the Order of Heptasophs in a dispute
over offering mutual aid to its membership. This group was organized for the
purpose of "uniting fraternally all white men of sound bodily health, good moral
character, socially acceptable, engaged in an honorable profession, business,
employment or occupation, between 18 and 50 years of age."

The society had its head office in Baltimore, Maryland, and its membership
reached 676,887 by 1915. As of May 1917, however, the IOH ceased to exist when
it merged with the Fraternal Aid Union (Lawrence, Kansas), which changed to the
Standard Life Association in 1933.
